briefdescription.para: Manages streans, cuBLAS handles and scratch memory for devices.
Instance that we own; contains the cuVS index.

detaileddescription.para: Returns a reference to our GpuResources object that manages memory, stream and handle resources on the GPU

Trains CAGRA based on the given vector data and add them along with ids. NB: The use of the add function here is to build the CAGRA graph on the base dataset. Use this function when you want to add vectors with ids. Ref: https://github.com/facebookresearch/faiss/issues/4107

Trains CAGRA based on the given vector data. NB: The use of the train function here is to build the CAGRA graph on the base dataset and is currently the only function to add the full set of vectors (without IDs) to the index. There is no external quantizer to be trained here.
Initialize ourselves from the given CPU index; will overwrite all data in ourselves
Copy ourselves to the given CPU index; will overwrite all data in the index instance

briefdescription.para: Removes all elements from the database.

memberdef.argsstring: (idx_t n, const uint8_t *x, idx_t k, int *distances, faiss::idx_t *labels, const faiss::SearchParameters *params=nullptr) const override
memberdef.name: search

detaileddescription.para: Same as add, but stores xids instead of sequential ids.
The default implementation fails with an assertion, as it is not supported by all indexes.

parameterdescription.para: if non-null, ids to store for the vectors (size n)

memberdef.argsstring: (idx_t n, const uint8_t *x, idx_t k, int32_t *distances, idx_t *labels, const SearchParameters *params=nullptr) const =0
memberdef.name: search

detaileddescription.para: Query n vectors of dimension d to the index.
return at most k vectors. If there are not enough results for a query, the result array is padded with -1s.

parameterdescription.para: input vectors to search, size n * d / 8
output labels of the NNs, size n*k

memberdef.argsstring: (idx_t n, const uint8_t *x, int radius, RangeSearchResult *result, const SearchParameters *params=nullptr) const
memberdef.name: range_search

detaileddescription.para: Query n vectors of dimension d to the index.

return all vectors with distance < radius. Note that many indexes do not implement the range_search (only the k-NN search is mandatory). The distances are converted to float to reuse the RangeSearchResult structure, but they are integer. By convention, only distances < radius (strict comparison) are returned, ie. radius = 0 does not return any result and 1 returns only exact same vectors.

parameterdescription.para: input vectors to search, size n * d / 8

memberdef.argsstring: (idx_t n, const uint8_t *x, idx_t *labels, idx_t k=1) const
memberdef.name: assign

detaileddescription.para: Return the indexes of the k vectors closest to the query x.

This function is identical to search but only returns labels of neighbors.
x
input vectors to search, size n * d / 8
labels
output labels of the NNs, size n*k
Removes IDs from the index. Not supported by all indexes.
Reconstruct a stored vector.

This function may not be defined for some indexes.
key
id of the vector to reconstruct
recons
reconstucted vector (size d / 8)
Reconstruct vectors i0 to i0 + ni - 1.

This function may not be defined for some indexes.
recons
reconstucted vectors (size ni * d / 8)

memberdef.argsstring: (idx_t n, const uint8_t *x, idx_t k, int32_t *distances, idx_t *labels, uint8_t *recons, const SearchParameters *params=nullptr) const
memberdef.name: search_and_reconstruct

detaileddescription.para: Similar to search, but also reconstructs the stored vectors (or an approximation in the case of lossy coding) for the search results.
If there are not enough results for a query, the resulting array is padded with -1s.
Display the actual class name and some more info.
moves the entries from another dataset to self. On output, other is empty. add_id is added to all moved ids (for sequential ids, this would be this->ntotal)
check that the two indexes are compatible (ie, they are trained in the same way and have the same parameters). Otherwise throw.
size of the produced codes in bytes
Same as add_with_ids for IndexBinary.

briefdescription.para: number of bytes per vector ( = d / 8 )
